title: API Integration Guide
author: Ekobol Developer Team
image_caption: Connect external systems with Ekobol's powerful API.
intro: Integrate Ekobol with third-party systems using our RESTful API. Automate workflows, sync data, and build custom integrations tailored to your business needs.
p1: Ekobol's API allows developers to programmatically access and manage products, orders, customers, and more. Perfect for custom integrations, automation workflows, and data synchronization.
li1_text: Products: Create, read, update, delete products and inventory
li2_text: Orders: Fetch orders, update status, manage fulfillment
li3_text: Customers: Access customer data, manage accounts
li4_text: Analytics: Pull sales reports and performance metrics
li5_text: Webhooks: Receive real-time notifications for events
p2: All API requests require authentication using API keys. Keep your keys secure and never expose them in client-side code.
li6_text: Go to Settings → Developer → API Keys
li10_text: Copy and save the key immediately (shown only once)
li11_text: Store securely (use environment variables, never commit to Git)
p3: Include your API key in the `Authorization` header with every request.
p4: To ensure fair usage and system stability, API requests are rate-limited.
p5: When you exceed the rate limit, the API returns HTTP 429 status. Respect the `Retry-After` header value.
li14_text: Batch requests instead of individual calls
p6: All endpoints follow RESTful conventions. Base URL: `https://api.ekobol.com/v1`
p8: Webhooks allow Ekobol to send real-time notifications to your server when specific events occur.
li18_text: Enter your server's callback URL (must be HTTPS)
li20_text: Set secret key for signature verification
p9: Verify webhook authenticity using signature validation to prevent spoofing.
p10: Always verify the `X-Ekobol-Signature` header matches your computed hash.
p11: List endpoints return paginated results to improve performance.
p12: Use pagination to fetch large datasets efficiently.
p13: The API uses standard HTTP status codes. All errors return JSON with details.
error_400_desc: Invalid request parameters or missing required fields
error_403_desc: API key doesn't have required permissions
error_500_desc: Something went wrong on Ekobol's side
p14: Follow these guidelines for reliable and efficient API usage.
li32_text: Use test API keys for development, switch to production keys only when live
li33_text: Implement retry logic with exponential backoff for failed requests
li34_text: Cache responses for frequently accessed, rarely changed data
li35_text: Use webhooks instead of polling for real-time updates
li36_text: Log all API requests/responses for debugging
li38_text: Never expose API keys in client-side code or Git repositories
li39_text: Rotate API keys quarterly or if compromised
li40_text: Use HTTPS for all webhook endpoints
li42_text: Implement IP whitelisting for extra security (Enterprise)
p15: Sample integrations in popular programming languages.
code5:
import requests

api_key = 'YOUR_API_KEY'
headers = {'Authorization': f'Bearer {api_key}'}

response = requests.get(
  'https://api.ekobol.com/v1/products',
  headers=headers
)

products = response.json()
print(f"Found {len(products)} products")
help_text: Need help with API integration? Check our full documentation or contact developer support.
